description: The dataset comprises data collected from simulated experiments conducted on small satellite BP930 batteries utilizing the MACCOR system. Two BP930 batteries, labeled as PK31 and PK35, underwent continuous operation to simulate a satellite's operational profile for a single cycle. Prior to the experiment, the battery packs were charged to an initial voltage of approximately 8.35 V, corresponding to 100% State of Charge (SOC). Both battery packs were subjected to similar operating conditions and loading profiles throughout the experiments.

references.citation:
Z. Cameron, C. Kulkarni , A. Guarneros, K. Goebel, S. Poll , “A Battery Certification Testbed for
Small Satellite Missions" , IEEE AUTOTESTCON 2015, Nov 2-5, 2015, National Harbor, MA

papers.Sun, Fangzhou, et al: Sun, Fangzhou, et al. "A data driven health monitoring approach to extending small sats mission." Proceedings of the annual conference of the PHM society. Vol. 10. 2018.
